searchParameters.q: how much is a 1970 dime worth

answerBox.snippet: The Red Book suggests a retail price of $2 for one of these coins, but it is not unusual to see them sell for less than 75¢ each. MS65-certified 1970 Roosevelt Dimes will routinely trade for under $10 each.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What year is the $2000000 dime?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The 1894-S Barber dime is a dime produced in the United States Barber coinage. It is one of the rarest and most highly prized United States coins for collectors, along with the 1804 dollar and the 1913 Liberty Head nickel. One was sold in 2005 for $1.3 million, and another for $1.9 million in 2007.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: 1894-S Barber dime - Wikipedia

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is a 1970 D coin worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: 1970 D quarter Value The Denver mint was the busiest, with 417,341,364 minted Washington quarters in 1970. All these 25-cent coins have the D mint mark on the obverse. The value of circulated coins is the same as their face value of 25 cents, while perfectly looking pieces cost $1 to $65.
